text: Hey, I'm trying out the new Accounting API, when I try to `PUT <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/extensions/accounting/settings/{myAppId}?hapikey={myApiKey}>` I get a 403 response with message "This API can't be called using an OAuth access token". Anyone know what I am doing wrong here?

Hi folks! Can somebody clarify for me whether it's possible to connect UWP apps to HubSpot Marketing?
We'd like to collect information about the users of the app and build comprehensive marketing automation interacting with these users based on their activities. To use HubSpot, the code should be installed in the app. So I'm curious if the code can be installed there to use HubSpot for our app. Thanks!
Hi everyone, does anyone know if there is any limit on contact property history versions we get in contact get call? Like only last 100 versions would be shown or not older than 6 months?
I don't think so, because of that need to have the search payload structure to express the arbitrary query
Probably there is a need for a param, whether they made one, and whether it is documented... that is going to be the issue...

need more detail

I would start here

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/extensions/calling-sdk>

<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/calling/integrate-a-third-party-calling-provider-with-HubSpot>

I saw some forum threads, which indicated that the cross-referencing ability between deals, and the products inside of them, is not very good

You could maybe work around it by storing some data about the product mix for the deal in a property of the deal to keep track of it

I am doing this in a system to have deals for >1 type of insurance policy, because the HubSpot quoting system is not configurable enough to sell insurance policies
I'd love to know that too, in particular also getting the new Search to work on engagements
<@UD53A9UUR>?

`idProperty`, I believe, does not actually work yet

Using the legacy API while they are still coding V3 is not considered a bug, but it might need code updates later when V3 APIs reach feature parity to their originals
Read closely... "resource with id null" means somehow the API was asked to retrieve record ID number null instead of record ID <some_number_here>
That sounds like a client side bug in some JS or Java code (or other programming language which calls null null)
It is in the works.  Sadly I don't have an official timeline on it.  Will advise as soon as I do!

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/extensions/calling-sdk>

<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/calling/integrate-a-third-party-calling-provider-with-HubSpot>

In general the Call engagement seems to be less flexible than many of the other ones right now
Likely... sent you links how to do so

"ignore email address errors"

we need a lot more specificity about what you tried and what went wrong and what you mean by error
#leastsatisfyinganswerever
there is probably a better way but we need more detail

performance / remote data query reasons, it is not going to be immediate

same issue happens if you create stuff and then instantly call search endpoint

some of this stuff happens async in the background
did the thing trying to do whatever it did actually have the permission or not?
I would start by re-checking the Roles assigned to the user accounts having the error first
ouch...

First theory: make sure the special accounting token scope they describe in the document, is enabled

Second theory: beta might require you to do an approval process, without which using the API will error out
In general let me say that this documentation is incredibly confusing because it only provides a list of URLs and hooks but it says absolutely nothing about what any of them actually do

This is very unfortunate because I probably could use this integration as one of the most difficult things I coded in the last year was a three way integration between HubSpot, <http://Bill.com|Bill.com>, and the Sage Intacct General Ledger
